      • addObservers

        public void addObservers(java.lang.String[] resources)
        Description copied from interface: IWebSocketBean
        Adds the observers. Convenience method to add multiple observers in one call Example: 
                                //assumes each script below will support all events (onMessage, onOpen, onClose, onError)
                        websocketBean.addObservers([
                        "/chat.nsf/observer.agent"
                        ,"/chat.nsf/observer.ssjs"
                        ,"/chat.nsf/observer.rb"
                        ,"/chat.nsf/observer.gvy"
                        ,"/chat.nsf/observer.py"
                        ,"/chat.nsf/observer.bsh"]);
                
                        }
        Specified by:
        addObservers in interface IWebSocketBean
        Parameters:
        resources - the sources

      • addEventObserver

        public void addEventObserver(java.lang.String function,
                             java.lang.String source)
        Description copied from interface: IWebSocketBean
        Adds the event observer to listen for a specific function / event (e.g. onMessage, onClose) Example using websocketBean managed bean: 
                                websocketBean.addEventObserver("onMessage","/chat.nsf/observer.ssjs");
        Specified by:
        addEventObserver in interface IWebSocketBean
        Parameters:
        function - the function
        source - the source

      • addUriListeners

        public void addUriListeners(java.lang.String uri,
                            java.lang.String[] sources)
        Description copied from interface: IWebSocketBean
        Adds the uri listeners. Convenience method to add multiple URI listeners to the same URI Example: 
                        //listeners only fire during onMessage
                websocketBean.addUriListeners("/chat.nsf*",
                [
                "/chat.nsf/listener.agent",
                "/chat.nsf/listener.py",
                "/chat.nsf/listener.rb",
                "/chat.nsf/listener.gvy",
                "/chat.nsf/listener.ssjs",
                "/chat.nsf/listener.bsh"
                ]);
        Specified by:
        addUriListeners in interface IWebSocketBean
        Parameters:
        uri - the uri
        sources - the sources

      • addUriListener

        public void addUriListener(java.lang.String source)
        Description copied from interface: IWebSocketBean
        Adds the uri listener. When using this method the listener only listens for direct invocations of itself Example: 
                        websocketBean.addUriListener("/chat.nsf/observer.ssjs");
        will only fire when the SocketMessage is sent directly to the script's path.
        Specified by:
        addUriListener in interface IWebSocketBean
        Parameters:
        source - the source

      • addIntervaledScripts

        public void addIntervaledScripts(int interval,
                                 java.lang.String[] sources)
        Description copied from interface: IWebSocketBean
        Adds the intervaled scripts. Convenience method to register multiple intervaled scripts Example using managed bean in XPages Each script referenced below runs every 30 seconds 
                         websocketBean.addIntervaledScripts(30, [
                "/chat.nsf/interval.agent",
                "/chat.nsf/interval.py",
                "/chat.nsf/interval.rb",
                "/chat.nsf/interval.gvy",
                "/chat.nsf/interval.ssjs",
                "/chat.nsf/interval.bsh"
                ]);
        Specified by:
        addIntervaledScripts in interface IWebSocketBean
        Parameters:
        interval - the interval
        sources - the sources

      • addToScriptScope

        public void addToScriptScope(java.lang.String name,
                             java.lang.Object bean)
        Description copied from interface: IWebSocketBean
        Register bean with scripts. Make an object available to executing scripts on the server Note: You are responsible for creating a name/key that will not collide with other scripts
        Specified by:
        addToScriptScope in interface IWebSocketBean
        Parameters:
        name - the key
        bean - the bean
